trans-unit.source: Office 365 DirSync test environment | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Office 365 DirSync test environment | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure an Office 365 Directory Synchronization (DirSync) server in a hybrid cloud for IT pro or development testing.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure an Office 365 Directory Synchronization (DirSync) server in a hybrid cloud for IT pro or development testing.

trans-unit.source: Set up Office 365 Directory Synchronization (DirSync) in a hybrid cloud for testing
trans-unit.target: Set up Office 365 Directory Synchronization (DirSync) in a hybrid cloud for testing

trans-unit.source: This topic steps you through creating a hybrid cloud environment for testing Office 365 Directory Synchronization (DirSync) with password synchronization hosted in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: This topic steps you through creating a hybrid cloud environment for testing Office 365 Directory Synchronization (DirSync) with password synchronization hosted in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: Here is the resulting configuration.
trans-unit.target: Here is the resulting configuration.

trans-unit.source: This configuration simulates a DirSync server in Azure production environment from your location on the Internet.
trans-unit.target: This configuration simulates a DirSync server in Azure production environment from your location on the Internet.

trans-unit.source: It consists of:
trans-unit.target: It consists of:

trans-unit.source: A simplified on-premises network (the Corpnet subnet).
trans-unit.target: A simplified on-premises network (the Corpnet subnet).

trans-unit.source: A cross-premises virtual network hosted in Azure (TestVNET).
trans-unit.target: A cross-premises virtual network hosted in Azure (TestVNET).

trans-unit.source: A site-to-site VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: A site-to-site VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: An Office 365 FastTrack trial subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Office 365 FastTrack trial subscription.

trans-unit.source: A DirSync server and secondary domain controller in the TestVNET virtual network.
trans-unit.target: A DirSync server and secondary domain controller in the TestVNET virtual network.

trans-unit.source: This configuration provides a basis and common starting point from which you can:
trans-unit.target: This configuration provides a basis and common starting point from which you can:

trans-unit.source: Develop and test applications for Office 365 that rely on synchronization with an on-premises Active Directory domain using password sync.
trans-unit.target: Develop and test applications for Office 365 that rely on synchronization with an on-premises Active Directory domain using password sync.

trans-unit.source: Perform testing of this cloud-based IT workload.
trans-unit.target: Perform testing of this cloud-based IT workload.

trans-unit.source: There are three major phases to setting up this hybrid cloud test environment:
trans-unit.target: There are three major phases to setting up this hybrid cloud test environment:

trans-unit.source: Set up the hybrid cloud environment for testing.
trans-unit.target: Set up the hybrid cloud environment for testing.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Office 365 FastTrack trial.
trans-unit.target: Configure the Office 365 FastTrack trial.

trans-unit.source: Configure the DirSync server (DS1).
trans-unit.target: Configure the DirSync server (DS1).

trans-unit.source: If you do not already have an Azure subscription, you can sign up for a free trial at <link><linkText>Try Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you do not already have an Azure subscription, you can sign up for a free trial at <link><linkText>Try Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you have an MSDN Subscription, see <link><linkText>Azure benefit for MSDN subscribers</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you have an MSDN Subscription, see <link><linkText>Azure benefit for MSDN subscribers</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Phase 1: Set up the hybrid cloud environment
trans-unit.target: Phase 1: Set up the hybrid cloud environment

trans-unit.source: Use the instructions in the <link><linkText>Set up a hybrid cloud environment for testing</linkText><title></title></link> topic.
trans-unit.target: Use the instructions in the <link><linkText>Set up a hybrid cloud environment for testing</linkText><title></title></link> topic.

trans-unit.source: Because this test environment does not require the presence of the APP1 server on the Corpnet subnet, feel free to shut it down for now.
trans-unit.target: Because this test environment does not require the presence of the APP1 server on the Corpnet subnet, feel free to shut it down for now.

trans-unit.source: This is your current configuration.
trans-unit.target: This is your current configuration.

trans-unit.source: For Phase 1, you can also set up the simulated hybrid cloud test environment.
trans-unit.target: For Phase 1, you can also set up the simulated hybrid cloud test environment.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Set up a simulated hybrid cloud environment for testing</linkText><title></title></link> for the instructions.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Set up a simulated hybrid cloud environment for testing</linkText><title></title></link> for the instructions.

trans-unit.source: Phase 2: Configure the Office 365 FastTrack Trial
trans-unit.target: Phase 2: Configure the Office 365 FastTrack Trial

trans-unit.source: To start your Office 365 FastTrack trial, you need a fictitious company name and a Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: To start your Office 365 FastTrack trial, you need a fictitious company name and a Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you use a variant of the company name Contoso for your company name, which is a fictitious company used in Microsoft sample content, but this isn’t required.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you use a variant of the company name Contoso for your company name, which is a fictitious company used in Microsoft sample content, but this isn’t required.

trans-unit.source: Next, sign up for a new Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: Next, sign up for a new Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: Go to http://outlook.com and create an account with an email address like user123@outlook.com.
trans-unit.target: Go to http://outlook.com and create an account with an email address like user123@outlook.com.

trans-unit.source: You will sign up for an Office 365 FastTrack trial using this account.
trans-unit.target: You will sign up for an Office 365 FastTrack trial using this account.

trans-unit.source: Next, sign up for a new Office 365 FastTrack trial.
trans-unit.target: Next, sign up for a new Office 365 FastTrack trial.

trans-unit.source: Log on to CLIENT1 with the CORP\User1 account credentials.
trans-unit.target: Log on to CLIENT1 with the CORP\User1 account credentials.

trans-unit.source: Open Internet Explorer and go to http://fasttrack.office.com.
trans-unit.target: Open Internet Explorer and go to http://fasttrack.office.com.

trans-unit.source: Click Getting started with FastTrack.
trans-unit.target: Click Getting started with FastTrack.

trans-unit.source: On the Getting Started with FastTrack page, under First, sign up for an Office 365 trial, click For enterprises, sign up here.
trans-unit.target: On the Getting Started with FastTrack page, under First, sign up for an Office 365 trial, click For enterprises, sign up here.

trans-unit.source: On the Step 1 page, fill in the page, specifying your new Microsoft account in Business email address, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Step 1 page, fill in the page, specifying your new Microsoft account in Business email address, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Step 2 page, type the name of an initial Office 365 account in the first field, your fictitious company name, and then a password.
trans-unit.target: On the Step 2 page, type the name of an initial Office 365 account in the first field, your fictitious company name, and then a password.

trans-unit.source: Record the resulting email address (such as user123@contoso123.onmicrosoft.com) and the password in a secure location.
trans-unit.target: Record the resulting email address (such as user123@contoso123.onmicrosoft.com) and the password in a secure location.

trans-unit.source: You will need this information to complete the Active Directory Sync tool Configuration Wizard in Phase 3.
trans-unit.target: You will need this information to complete the Active Directory Sync tool Configuration Wizard in Phase 3.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Step 3 page, type the phone number of your text message-capable cellular or smart phone, and then click Text me.
trans-unit.target: On the Step 3 page, type the phone number of your text message-capable cellular or smart phone, and then click Text me.

trans-unit.source: After you receive the text message on your phone, type the verification code, and then click Create my account.
trans-unit.target: After you receive the text message on your phone, type the verification code, and then click Create my account.

trans-unit.source: When Office 365 is done creating your account, click You're ready to go.
trans-unit.target: When Office 365 is done creating your account, click You're ready to go.

trans-unit.source: You should now see the main Office 365 portal page.
trans-unit.target: You should now see the main Office 365 portal page.

trans-unit.source: In the top ribbon, click Admin, and then click Office 365.
trans-unit.target: In the top ribbon, click Admin, and then click Office 365.

trans-unit.source: The Office 365 admin center page appears.
trans-unit.target: The Office 365 admin center page appears.

trans-unit.source: Keep this page open on CLIENT1.
trans-unit.target: Keep this page open on CLIENT1.

trans-unit.source: This is your current configuration.
trans-unit.target: This is your current configuration.

trans-unit.source: Phase 3: Configure the DirSync server (DS1)
trans-unit.target: Phase 3: Configure the DirSync server (DS1)

trans-unit.source: First, create an Azure Virtual Machine for DS1 with these commands at the Azure PowerShell command prompt on your local computer. Prior to running these commands, fill in the variable values and remove the < and > characters.
trans-unit.target: First, create an Azure Virtual Machine for DS1 with these commands at the Azure PowerShell command prompt on your local computer. Prior to running these commands, fill in the variable values and remove the < and > characters.

trans-unit.source: Next, connect to the DS1 virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Next, connect to the DS1 virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: On the virtual machines page of the Azure Management Portal, click Running in the STATUS column for the DS1 virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: On the virtual machines page of the Azure Management Portal, click Running in the STATUS column for the DS1 virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: In the task bar, click Connect.
trans-unit.target: In the task bar, click Connect.

trans-unit.source: When prompted to open DS1.rdp, click Open.
trans-unit.target: When prompted to open DS1.rdp, click Open.

trans-unit.source: When prompted with a Remote Desktop Connection message box, click Connect.
trans-unit.target: When prompted with a Remote Desktop Connection message box, click Connect.

trans-unit.source: When prompted for credentials, use these:
trans-unit.target: When prompted for credentials, use these:

trans-unit.source: Name: CORP\User1
trans-unit.target: Name: CORP\User1

trans-unit.source: Password: [User1 account password]
trans-unit.target: Password: [User1 account password]

trans-unit.source: When prompted with a Remote Desktop Connection message box referring to certificates, click Yes.
trans-unit.target: When prompted with a Remote Desktop Connection message box referring to certificates, click Yes.

trans-unit.source: Next, configure a Windows Firewall rule to allow traffic for basic connectivity testing.
trans-unit.target: Next, configure a Windows Firewall rule to allow traffic for basic connectivity testing.

trans-unit.source: From an administrator-level Windows PowerShell command prompt on DS1, run these commands.
trans-unit.target: From an administrator-level Windows PowerShell command prompt on DS1, run these commands.

trans-unit.source: The ping command should result in four successful replies from IP address 10.0.0.1.
trans-unit.target: The ping command should result in four successful replies from IP address 10.0.0.1.

trans-unit.source: Next, install .NET 3.5 on DS1 with this command at the Windows PowerShell command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Next, install .NET 3.5 on DS1 with this command at the Windows PowerShell command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Next, install Directory Sync on DS1.
trans-unit.target: Next, install Directory Sync on DS1.

trans-unit.source: Run Internet Explorer, type http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=278924 in the Address bar, and then press ENTER.
trans-unit.target: Run Internet Explorer, type http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=278924 in the Address bar, and then press ENTER.

trans-unit.source: When prompted to run dirsync.exe, click the arrow next to Save, click Save As, and then click Save to save the file in the Downloads folder.
trans-unit.target: When prompted to run dirsync.exe, click the arrow next to Save, click Save As, and then click Save to save the file in the Downloads folder.

trans-unit.source: For more information about installing the tool, see <link><linkText>Install or upgrade the Directory Sync tool</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about installing the tool, see <link><linkText>Install or upgrade the Directory Sync tool</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Open the Downloads folder, right-click the dirsync file, and then click Run as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Open the Downloads folder, right-click the dirsync file, and then click Run as administrator.

trans-unit.source: On the Welcome page of the Active Directory Sync Setup wizard, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Welcome page of the Active Directory Sync Setup wizard, click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the License Terms page, click I accept, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the License Terms page, click I accept, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Select Folder Installation page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Select Folder Installation page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: It may take a several minutes to complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: It may take a several minutes to complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: On the Finished page, clear Start Configuration Wizard now, and then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: On the Finished page, clear Start Configuration Wizard now, and then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: From the Start screen, click user1, and then click Sign out.
trans-unit.target: From the Start screen, click user1, and then click Sign out.

trans-unit.source: Next, enable Directory Synchronization for your Office 365 FastTrack trial.
trans-unit.target: Next, enable Directory Synchronization for your Office 365 FastTrack trial.

trans-unit.source: On CLIENT1, on the Office 365 admin center page, in the left pane, click Users, and then click Active Users.
trans-unit.target: On CLIENT1, on the Office 365 admin center page, in the left pane, click Users, and then click Active Users.

trans-unit.source: For Active Directory synchronization, click Set up.
trans-unit.target: For Active Directory synchronization, click Set up.

trans-unit.source: On the Set up and manage Active Directory synchronization page, in step 3, click Activate.
trans-unit.target: On the Set up and manage Active Directory synchronization page, in step 3, click Activate.

trans-unit.source: When prompted with Do you want to activate Active Directory synchronization?, click Activate.
trans-unit.target: When prompted with Do you want to activate Active Directory synchronization?, click Activate.

trans-unit.source: After you do this, Active Directory synchronization is activated appears in step 3.
trans-unit.target: After you do this, Active Directory synchronization is activated appears in step 3.

trans-unit.source: Leave the Set up and manage Active Directory synchronization page open on CLIENT1.
trans-unit.target: Leave the Set up and manage Active Directory synchronization page open on CLIENT1.

trans-unit.source: Next, log on to DC1 with the CORP\User1 account and open an administrator-level Windows PowerShell command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Next, log on to DC1 with the CORP\User1 account and open an administrator-level Windows PowerShell command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Run these commands one at a time to create a new organizational unit called contoso_users and add two new user accounts for Marci Kaufman and Lynda Meyer.
trans-unit.target: Run these commands one at a time to create a new organizational unit called contoso_users and add two new user accounts for Marci Kaufman and Lynda Meyer.

trans-unit.source: When you run each Windows PowerShell command, you are prompted for the new user’s password.
trans-unit.target: When you run each Windows PowerShell command, you are prompted for the new user’s password.

trans-unit.source: Record these passwords and store them in a secure location.
trans-unit.target: Record these passwords and store them in a secure location.

trans-unit.source: You will need them later.
trans-unit.target: You will need them later.

trans-unit.source: Next, configure Directory Sync on DS1.
trans-unit.target: Next, configure Directory Sync on DS1.

trans-unit.source: Log in to DS1 with the CORP\User1 account.
trans-unit.target: Log in to DS1 with the CORP\User1 account.

trans-unit.source: On the Start screen, type Directory Sync.
trans-unit.target: On the Start screen, type Directory Sync.

trans-unit.source: Right-click Directory Sync Configuration, and then click Run as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Right-click Directory Sync Configuration, and then click Run as administrator.

trans-unit.source: This starts the configuration wizard.
trans-unit.target: This starts the configuration wizard.

trans-unit.source: On the Welcome page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Welcome page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Microsoft Azure Active Directory Credentials page, type the email address and password of the initial account you created when you set up the Office 365 FastTrack trial in Phase 2.
trans-unit.target: On the Microsoft Azure Active Directory Credentials page, type the email address and password of the initial account you created when you set up the Office 365 FastTrack trial in Phase 2.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Active Directory Credentials page, type CORP\User1 in User name and the User1 account password in Password.
trans-unit.target: On the Active Directory Credentials page, type CORP\User1 in User name and the User1 account password in Password.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Hybrid Deployment page, select Enable Hybrid Deployment, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Hybrid Deployment page, select Enable Hybrid Deployment, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Password Synchronization page, select Enable Password Sync, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Password Synchronization page, select Enable Password Sync, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: The Configuration page displays.
trans-unit.target: The Configuration page displays.

trans-unit.source: When configuration is complete, click Next.
trans-unit.target: When configuration is complete, click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Finished page, click Finish.
trans-unit.target: On the Finished page, click Finish.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, click OK.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, click OK.

trans-unit.source: Next, verify that the user accounts in the CORP domain are synchronized to Office 365.
trans-unit.target: Next, verify that the user accounts in the CORP domain are synchronized to Office 365.

trans-unit.source: Note that it can take a few hours before synchronization occurs.
trans-unit.target: Note that it can take a few hours before synchronization occurs.

trans-unit.source: On CLIENT1, on the Set up and manage Active Directory synchronization page, click the users link in step 6 of this page.
trans-unit.target: On CLIENT1, on the Set up and manage Active Directory synchronization page, click the users link in step 6 of this page.

trans-unit.source: If directory synchronization has occurred successfully, you should see something similar to this.
trans-unit.target: If directory synchronization has occurred successfully, you should see something similar to this.

trans-unit.source: The Status column indicates that the account was obtained through synchronization with an Active Directory domain.
trans-unit.target: The Status column indicates that the account was obtained through synchronization with an Active Directory domain.

trans-unit.source: Next, demonstrate Office 365 password sync with the Lynda Myer Active Directory account.
trans-unit.target: Next, demonstrate Office 365 password sync with the Lynda Myer Active Directory account.

trans-unit.source: On CLIENT1, on the Active Users page, select the Lynda Meyer account.
trans-unit.target: On CLIENT1, on the Active Users page, select the Lynda Meyer account.

trans-unit.source: In the properties of the Lynda Meyer account, under Assigned license, click Edit.
trans-unit.target: In the properties of the Lynda Meyer account, under Assigned license, click Edit.

trans-unit.source: In the Assign License tab, select a location in Set user location (such as United States).
trans-unit.target: In the Assign License tab, select a location in Set user location (such as United States).

trans-unit.source: Select Microsoft Office 365 Plan E3, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Select Microsoft Office 365 Plan E3, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Close Internet Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Close Internet Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Run Internet Explorer and go to http://portal.microsoftonline.com.
trans-unit.target: Run Internet Explorer and go to http://portal.microsoftonline.com.

trans-unit.source: Log on with Lynda Meyer’s Office 365 credentials. Her user name will be lyndam@<html></html>.onmicrosoft.com. The password is the Lynda Meyer Active Directory user account password.
trans-unit.target: Log on with Lynda Meyer’s Office 365 credentials. Her user name will be lyndam@<html></html>.onmicrosoft.com. The password is the Lynda Meyer Active Directory user account password.

trans-unit.source: After the successful logon, you see the Office 365 main portal page with Let's make a difference today.
trans-unit.target: After the successful logon, you see the Office 365 main portal page with Let's make a difference today.

trans-unit.source: This is your current configuration.
trans-unit.target: This is your current configuration.

trans-unit.source: This environment is now ready for you to perform testing of Office 365 applications that rely on Office 365 DirSync functionality or to test DirSync functionality and performance from DS1.
trans-unit.target: This environment is now ready for you to perform testing of Office 365 applications that rely on Office 365 DirSync functionality or to test DirSync functionality and performance from DS1.

trans-unit.target: Additional resources

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Set up a SharePoint intranet farm in a hybrid cloud for testing</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Azure infrastructure services implementation guidelines</linkText><title></title></link>
